requestBody.name: GetResourcesEndpointParams
requestBody.description: Parameters for fetching multiple resources in a single request. This allows batch operations for better performance.

workspaceId.description: The ID of the workspace to fetch resources from. If not provided, uses the user's default workspace.

type.name: FetchResourceItem
type.description: Specifies how to fetch a specific resource. You can identify resources by ID, filepath, or folderpath, combined with the action you want to perform.

data.description: A single resource ID or an array of resource IDs

resourceId.description: The unique identifier(s) of the resource(s) to fetch. Can be a single ID or an array of IDs.

action.description: The action to perform on the resource. Common actions include "read", "write", "delete", etc.

data.description: A single file path or an array of file paths

types.description: File path, with each folder name separated by a forward slash. The first item must be the workspace rootname, and must include the file extension. e.g /workspace-rootname/my-folder/my-file.txt.
File path as a list of folder and file names. e.g ["my-folder", "my-file.txt"].

filepath.description: The file path(s) to fetch. Use forward slashes as path separators. Can be a single path or an array of paths.

data.description: A single folder path or an array of folder paths

types.description: Folder path, with each folder name separated by a forward slash. The first item must be the workspace rootname. e.g /workspace-rootname/my-folder/my-sub-folder.
Folder path as a list of folder names. Must include the workspace rootname. e.g ["workspace-rootname", "my-folder", "my-sub-folder"].

folderpath.description: The folder path(s) to fetch. Use forward slashes as path separators. Can be a single path or an array of paths.

data.description: Workspace root name, must be a URL compatible name, case insensitive

workspaceRootname.description: The root name of the workspace. If not provided, uses the default workspace.

resources.description: Array of resource fetch specifications. Each item describes how to identify and what action to perform on a resource.

data.description: HTTP response content length in bytes

responseBody.name: GetResourcesEndpointResult
responseBody.description: Response containing the requested resources. Each resource is wrapped with metadata for easy identification.

resource.name: File
resource.description: File resource with metadata and location information

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens
Folder ID or null if resource is not in a folder (e.g., at workspace root)
Folder path as a list of folder names. It should not include the workspace rootname. e.g ["my-folder", "my-sub-folder"].
File version, representing how many times a file has been uploaded

resource.name: Folder
resource.description: Represents a folder in the workspace with its metadata and hierarchy information

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens
Folder path as a list of folder names. It should not include the workspace rootname. e.g ["my-folder", "my-sub-folder"].
Folder ID or null if resource is not in a folder (e.g., at workspace root)

type.name: ResourceWrapper
type.description: Wraps a resource with metadata about its type and ID. This provides context about what kind of resource is being returned.

resourceId.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

data.name: Resource
data.description: The actual resource data. The structure varies depending on the resource type (file, folder, workspace, etc.).

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

data.name: Agent
data.description: Represents a user or system entity that performed an action (e.g., created or updated a resource)
Agent ID. Possible agents are users and agent tokens

resource.description: The resource data. Structure depends on the resource type specified in resourceType field.

resources.description: Array of resource wrappers containing the requested resources and their metadata.

name: fimidara/resources/getResources
description: Fetch multiple resources in a single request. This endpoint allows you to retrieve files, folders, and other resources by specifying different identification methods (ID, filepath, or folderpath) and the actions you want to perform on them. Perfect for batch operations and reducing API calls.

data.description: HTTP response content length in bytes
